social: network with strong ties within the business unit
exploitative.summary: The exploitative skill set is focused on analytical and problem-solving skills. It requires the employee to find the best option within many and mediate between colleagues of different opinion. The employee should have a short-term focus.

explorative.summary: The explorative skill set is the opposite. It incorporates someone who is creative and tries to find as many solutions as possible. The character thinks long-term by recombining different technologies and business models.

personal: open to change without neglecting old processes
knowledge-brokerage - proactively sharing and gathering knowledge
methodical: role integration by finding synergies between roles
social: complex network within and across business units
diplomatic skills, e.g. tailoring communication towards situation
ambidextrous.summary: The ambidextrous person combines both explorative and exploitative skills. This person can think long-term and short-term, generate ideas and decide the best, simultaneously.
